result.execSummary:
The defendant Wojciech Kowalski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  AODA and comply.  6 month review in writing.  Any bond on hand will be applied towards costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wojciech Kowalski

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Wojciech Kowalski, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter sworn ( Ann Pawlik).  Cases called: 15CM226 & 15CM259.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1 of each case.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered in each case.  In both cases Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years each.  Conditions of probation include:  Maintain absolute sobriety.  AODA and comply.  In 15CM226 $543.00 costs.  2 days jail credit.  In 15CM259 $443.00 costs.  4 days jail credit.  Cash bond on hand will be applied towards costs.  6 month review on both in writing.
with Maintain absolute sobriety. No violent/abusive contact with C.K.

Translator Anna Pawlik sworn in. Translator Anna Pawlik sworn in.Defendant, Wojciech Kowalski, appeared, in custody, with Atty. Raabe. Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $1,500 recog. bond with Maintain absolute sobriety. No violent/abusive contact with C.K.  Dates do work for Translator.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 10:10 am.  Return date scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
